content: that you will have enough yarn if it weighs no more than 20% of your total yarn e g not more than 20 g if you started with a 100 g skein then you should have enough yarn to complete it work r01-r12 four additional times for a total of 60 row plus the foundation chain don t cut your yarn yet after completing the fifth segment suggested finishing method 1 fold the hat lengthwise so that the wrong side of the fabric is on the outside 2 chain 1 and seam the hat with a row of 50 single_crochet working from the top of the hat to the bottom work each single_crochet through the foundation chain and the back loop of the final row 3 leave a ~6 long tail and cut the yarn weave in the ends 4 cut a piece of yarn about 8 long and use it to seam the hole at the top of the hat using mattress stitch and weave in these ends completed hat pictured cuffed left and uncuffed right i d love to see your finished hats ● add your project on ravelry ● if you re sharing your beanie on instagram use the tag #tidepoolcrochetbeanie and tag me @margaretmakesthings 3 v2025 01 21 tidepool beanie © 2025 margaret sy yoslst join when working a yoslst into a stitch directly after a short row ends the stitch is slightly modified to reduce holes in the fabric it s essentially an invisible decrease over the turning chain 1 yarn over 2 insert your hook in the back bump loop of the previous row s turning chain 3 insert the hook into the back loop of the next available stitch i e if you are on r06 you start out working the stitches into r05 but after r05 runs out you start working into r01 4 yarn over and pull up a loop you should now have 4 loops on the hook 5 pull the loop you made in step 4 through the other 3 loops 4
